decks.notes: This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on early pressure and disruption to control the pace of the game. By utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler, alongside disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle, the deck aims to quickly close out games while preventing the opponent from establishing a strong board presence. The mana base is optimized for consistency and mana denial with Wasteland and fetchlands. The inclusion of versatile spells like Snapcaster Mage and versatile counterspells like Spell Pierce and Spell Snare provide additional options for adapting to different matchups.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base and game plan while deploying aggressive threats that can quickly close out games. By utilizing Aether Vial, Thalia, and other disruptive creatures, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's development while utilizing cards like Stoneforge Mystic to efficiently find powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to further pressure the opponent. With a mix of disruptive elements and efficient threats, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents in the Legacy format with a combination of aggro and resource denial strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The key strategy is to use cards like Standstill to slow down the opponent's progress while generating advantage through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Supreme Verdict, while also disrupting the opponent's plans with counterspells like Force of Will. The inclusion of cards like Engineered Explosives and Humility provide additional ways to control the board and maintain dominance throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of powerful planeswalkers, disruptive spells, and efficient creatures to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By using cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan, along with cards like Force of Will and Fatal Push for removal, the deck aims to control the board and win the game through incremental advantage. With a mix of permission spells and versatile threats, the Grixis Control deck looks to grind out victories through careful decision making and resource management.

This deck focuses on using a combination of lands to control the opponent's resources and win the game. By utilizing cards like Exploration and Life from the Loam, the player can quickly develop their land base and outvalue their opponent. The key win condition of the deck involves assembling the Dark Depths/Thespian's Stage combo to create a powerful 20/20 creature. Additionally, the deck includes versatile utility lands like Maze of Ith and Rishadan Port to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to grind out a victory through resource denial and land-based synergies.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly through various rituals and mana-producing cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, and then use a combination of cantrips and card draw spells to dig for the combo pieces. The ultimate goal is to assemble the necessary cards to cast a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to kill the opponent in a single turn. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Cabal Therapy and Duress to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies by using tax effects and aggressive creatures, while also using equipment to push through damage and control the board. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with efficient creatures like Thalia and Mirran Crusader, while also disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port. The use of Aether Vial allows for explosive starts and the ability to play creatures at instant speed, giving the deck a versatile and adaptive gameplay style.

This deck focuses on quickly locking down the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, while also disrupting their spells with Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures like Chandra's Phoenix, Flamewake Phoenix, and Thundermaw Hellkite to close out the game quickly. The mana acceleration from Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors allows for explosive starts, while the combination of Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Slash Panther provide additional removal and damage.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Food Chain card to generate infinite mana by exiling creatures, allowing you to play powerful creatures such as Walking Ballista and Misthollow Griffin repeatedly. The deck includes cards like Manipulate Fate and Eternal Scourge to help facilitate this combo. Leovold, Emissary of Trest provides additional utility and disruption, while cards like Force of Will and Deathrite Shaman help control the game and protect your combo. The deck aims to set up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on utilizing efficient removal spells, powerful planeswalkers, and disruptive creatures to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent. It seeks to generate card advantage through cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder while protecting its threats with counterspells like Force of Will. The deck also has access to hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing its own threats to eventually close out the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays while establishing a strong board presence with Stoneforge Mystic fetching equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull. The deck includes a variety of powerful control spells like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The planeswalkers Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide card advantage and powerful abilities. Lingering Souls provides a steady stream of creatures while True-Name Nemesis is a difficult-to-deal-with threat. The deck aims to control the game and dictate the pace of play.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of disruption, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes a variety of powerful planeswalkers and creatures to outvalue the opponent, while also having access to efficient counterspells and removal spells to deal with threats. The mana base is carefully crafted to have access to the necessary colors while also being able to fetch specific lands when needed. Overall, the deck aims to grind out incremental advantages over time and ultimately overpower the opponent through superior card advantage and board control.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deploy disruptive creatures such as Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis while also utilizing efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt to control the board. The deck aims to keep pressure on the opponent with a combination of early threats and countermagic in the form of Daze and Force of Will. By disrupting the opponent's game plan and presenting a fast clock with evasive threats, the deck looks to close out games quickly and efficiently.

The main focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Deathrite Shaman. The deck also includes disruption spells like Cabal Therapy and countermagic like Force of Will to control the game. The deck aims to use efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Kolaghan's Command to remove threats and finish the game quickly. The mana base consists of a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure smooth mana production while also including Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command, and counter magic with Force of Will. It also utilizes efficient card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to outvalue the opponent in the late game. The deck aims to control the board and dictate the pace of the game, eventually closing out with powerful threats like Gurmag Angler or Leovold, Emissary of Trest.
